title: Lol Launcher wont open
body: Yesterday league worked fine, today its not working at all. The problem is when i go to click on the 'League of Legends' icon or the exe file or whatever to actually try start the LOL logo appears then disappears quickly. I have already tried deleting all of the files and tried all of the fixes on the internet i could find. For example i have deleted the patcher and launcher and basically everything. I have changed my screen resolution, still nothing, ive run it in compatibility mode still nothing. Just then i uninstalled and deleted everything league related off my computer then went to the OCE lol site to download the game again. Getting the exact same problem i could download the installer fine and that ran up to a point where the league logo would pop up with a thin white loading bar underneath it this got to 60% and then disappeared without anything happening. When i was attempting earlier fixes like deleting the lol launcher file and patcher file out of the RADS folder it would get to this abovementioned point and then just disappear at the thin loading bar at 60%. It would also pop up with a pvp.net patcher kernel is not working every now and again. Like i said i have tried all of the fixes i could find and tried running as admin etc etc and  just then tried reinstalling nothing is working. Any ideas, any help is appreciated. Thanks for reading.

replies.body: Same problem, fixed by disabling Ad-Aware anti virus

i have disabled my mcaffee disabled the firewall then tried still nothing. when it appears and then disappears if i leave it alone it comes up with BugsplatRC Resource DLL not found. Ive tried cc cleaner and cleaning out my registyr files etc etc but that doesnt work. pretty annoyed. Nobody from riot helping. We spend good money. Guess il just try log on next week see if they have bothered to use any of their millions of dollars of profit towards the maintenance and up keep of their game.

Greetings AceDM,

Thanks for providing a list of what you've already tried! It'll definitely help out in narrowing down the cause of the problem. Can you try the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article? 

>1. Switch to a wired (ethernet) connection. Wireless connections may be weak or have interference, causing a disruption and preventing a stable internet connection to the League of Legends servers. 
2. Disable any firewalls and/or antivirus applications that you may have running. These firewalls may block outbound and inbound League of Legends connections, causing some serious problems and preventing you from getting on the Rift! For help disabling your firewall(s), check out [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3).
3. Disable IPv6, as the League of Legends client is designed to work with IPv4. For help disabling IPv6, check out [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4).
4. Configure your DNS to use a public Domain Name System. For help configuring your DNS settings, check out [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5).
5. If possible, try port forwarding the League of Legends ports. For a list of the ports that League of Legends uses and more information on how to set up port forwarding, check out [**this article**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq8).
6. Check for VPN and proxy usage. If necessary, [**reset your Internet Explorer settings**](http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/internet-explorer/reset-ie-settings). 
7. Disable IP Helper. To do this, open the start menu, search "services", and select "Services.msc" or "Services" (depending on operating system). Locate IP Helper, right-click on it, and select "Properties". On the properties page, select "Startup type" and select "Disable". Under "Service status", click on "Stop" and then apply the settings. 
8. Now, lastly, [**flush your DNS and release/renew IP**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq10).

I have tried all of this and also resetting winsock i have restarted my router and i am on an ethernet connection. The game was working fine up until the patch day when i tried it on patch day this problem occurred. Any other ideas...
Upload your latest patcher log to http://upload.wrenchmen.org/ and link it here.

i tried uploading it but the link just says the file has been deleted.  I tried it again before it disappeared i left my computer like that for a couple hours then it popped up with screen saying lol patcher has stopped working and also BugsplatRC Resource DLL not found.
im having this problem aswell, i have done everything to try and fix it but nothing is working. it happened to me as soon as they realsed the new patch

If it's happening to us it's happening to hundreds of other people too and it's most likely an issue with league of legends itself. It's not a problem on our PCs since everything worked fine prior to 5.23. That's my opinion.

Same here, have tried to fix it whole day. Running as admin etc. nothing seems to work, this happened after the patch 5.23 patch release for me as well. "The league logo would pop up with a thin white loading bar underneath it this got to 60% and then disappeared without anything happening". Yeah bro I feel the pain.... man this is so frustrating..... //EUW Client here//
Its more then frustrating XD just want to play the game. im glad im not the only one having this issue

I got one message in middle of the fixing hassle but just once in the billion attempts "PVP.net patcher kernel has stopped working". Maybe it has something to do with it but Im not sure. I've come across this patcher problem once before like a year ago and got it fixed but cant find a way to do it now :/
yeah i had that a few times already whent throught the process of fixing that didnt make a difference :/

I found a way to fix it for myself, cant say it it works for you guys. A good board about this same problem -> http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/EE0tnXs5-new-having-issues-patching-523-click-here

Guy named DARTAGNAN said that ad-aware antivirus could be the problem for not being compatible for this patch or something like that. I changed from ad-aware to avast and now it works perfectly. I think some antiviruses might block this patch from properly patching it. Good luck, hope this helps a bit!
